intro: Voyria rosea, commonly known as the pink fairy fan, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a low, spreading growth habit with evergreen foliage that remains lush throughout the year. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, often with a slight waxy coating. Voyria rosea thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments.
